input.report:
16/07/2025, 00:00, ECHO HEART

Case History:

Reason for Request: Pre-operative assessment. No previous cardiac history.

Findings: Physiological tricuspid regurgitation only. Normal cardiac structure and function. No structural heart disease. No follow-up required. No intervention required. Discharge from clinic.

Dr Sarah Mitchell, Consultant Paediatric Cardiologist 16/07/2025, 00:00

05/02/2025, 00:00, CARDIAC MRI

Case History:

Reason for Request: Syncope during exercise. Known Hypoplastic Left Heart Syndrome. Assessment.

From clinical notes: Hypoplastic Left Heart Syndrome. Previous cardiac interventions.

Findings: Echocardiogram demonstrates hypoplastic left heart syndrome with aortic atresia. Right ventricle dominant with moderate systolic function. Patent ductus arteriosus widely patent. Atrial septum intact - needs intervention. Recommend cardiology follow-up and surgical planning.

Dr Sophie Richardson, Consultant Paediatric Cardiologist 05/02/2025, 00:00

11/02/2025, 00:00, FETAL ECHO

Case History:

Reason for Request: Routine screening. No previous cardiac history.

Findings: Physiological tricuspid regurgitation only. Normal cardiac structure and function. No structural heart disease. No follow-up required. No intervention required. Routine follow-up.

Dr Michael Taylor, Consultant Paediatric Cardiologist 11/02/2025, 00:00

20/08/2025, 00:00, ECHO HEART

Case History:

Reason for Request: Palpitations reported. No previous cardiac history.

Findings: Normal sinus rhythm at 65 bpm. Normal PR interval. Normal QRS duration. Normal QTc interval. No evidence of ventricular hypertrophy. Normal ECG for age. No intervention required. No further investigation needed.

Dr Emma Wilson, Consultant Paediatric Cardiologist 20/08/2025, 00:00

16/03/2025, 00:00, CARDIAC MRI

Case History:

Reason for Request: Known congenital heart disease follow-up. Known Ventricular Septal Defect. Assessment.

From clinical notes: Ventricular Septal Defect. Previous cardiac interventions.

Findings: Echocardiogram demonstrates large perimembranous ventricular septal defect measuring 10mm. Significant left-to-right shunt with Qp:Qs ratio of 2.6:1. Left atrial and left ventricular dilation present. Pulmonary artery pressure elevated. Recommend cardiology follow-up and MDT discussion.

Dr Michael Taylor, Consultant Paediatric Cardiologist 16/03/2025, 00:00

15/01/2025, 00:00, ECHO HEART

Case History:

Reason for Request: Family history of cardiomyopathy screening. No previous cardiac history.

Findings: Innocent flow murmur confirmed. Normal cardiac structure. Normal valve function. No pathological murmur identified. Reassurance given. No intervention required. Discharge from clinic.

Dr Emma Wilson, Consultant Paediatric Cardiologist 15/01/2025, 00:00

23/05/2025, 00:00, CARDIAC MRI

Case History:

Reason for Request: Known congenital heart disease follow-up. Known Pulmonary Atresia. Assessment.

From clinical notes: Pulmonary Atresia. Previous cardiac interventions.

Findings: Echocardiogram demonstrates pulmonary atresia with intact ventricular septum. Right ventricular hypoplasia. Pulmonary blood flow dependent on patent ductus arteriosus. Major aortopulmonary collateral arteries present. Recommend cardiology follow-up and continued surveillance.

Dr Sophie Richardson, Consultant Paediatric Cardiologist 23/05/2025, 00:00

14/11/2025, 00:00, ECHO HEART

Case History:

Reason for Request: Poor feeding and failure to thrive. Known Truncus Arteriosus. Assessment.

From clinical notes: Truncus Arteriosus. Previous cardiac interventions.

Findings: Echocardiogram demonstrates truncus arteriosus type II. Single arterial trunk overriding both ventricles. Large ventricular septal defect. Truncal valve with mild regurgitation. Pulmonary arteries arising from common trunk. Recommend cardiology follow-up and catheterization.

Dr James Chen, Consultant Paediatric Cardiologist 14/11/2025, 00:00

08/08/2025, 00:00, ECHO HEART

Case History:

Reason for Request: Parental concern. No previous cardiac history.

Findings: Post-viral pericarditis - resolved. Small residual pericardial effusion with no hemodynamic significance. Normal ventricular function. Follow-up imaging recommended. No intervention required. Discharge from clinic.

Dr Sophie Richardson, Consultant Paediatric Cardiologist 08/08/2025, 00:00

06/05/2025, 00:00, ECHO HEART

Case History:

Reason for Request: Family history of CHD. Known Interrupted Aortic Arch. Assessment.

From clinical notes: Interrupted Aortic Arch. Previous cardiac interventions.

Findings: Echocardiogram demonstrates interrupted aortic arch type II. No continuity between ascending and descending aorta. Large ventricular septal defect. Patent ductus arteriosus supplying lower body. Recommend cardiology follow-up and MDT discussion.

Dr Rachel Patel, Consultant Paediatric Cardiologist 06/05/2025, 00:00

14/01/2025, 00:00, ECG 12-LEAD

Case History:

Reason for Request: Chest pain evaluation. No previous cardiac history.

Findings: Normal cardiac anatomy on fetal echocardiography. Four-chamber view normal. Outflow tracts visualized and patent. No abnormality detected. No intervention required. Reassurance provided.

Dr Laura Bennett, Consultant Paediatric Cardiologist 14/01/2025, 00:00

05/06/2025, 00:00, ECG 12-LEAD

Case History:

Reason for Request: Palpitations reported. No previous cardiac history.

Findings: Innocent flow murmur confirmed. Normal cardiac structure. Normal valve function. No pathological murmur identified. Reassurance given. No intervention required. Reassurance provided.

Dr Sarah Mitchell, Consultant Paediatric Cardiologist 05/06/2025, 00:00

27/12/2025, 00:00, CARDIAC MRI

Case History:

Reason for Request: Family history of cardiomyopathy screening. No previous cardiac history.

Findings: Mild physiological pulmonary regurgitation. Structurally normal heart. Normal biventricular function. No intervention required. No intervention required. Routine follow-up.

Dr Michael Taylor, Consultant Paediatric Cardiologist 27/12/2025, 00:00

Findings: Echocardiogram demonstrates double outlet right ventricle with subaortic ventricular septal defect. Both great arteries arise from right ventricle. No pulmonary stenosis. Recommend cardiology follow-up and catheterization.

From clinical notes: Transposition of Great Arteries. Previous cardiac interventions.

Findings: Echocardiogram demonstrates complete transposition of the great arteries. Aorta arises from right ventricle and pulmonary artery from left ventricle. Large atrial septal defect providing mixing. Surgical intervention required. Recommend cardiology follow-up and surgical planning.

Dr Sarah Mitchell, Consultant Paediatric Cardiologist 13/04/2025, 00:00

04/06/2025, 00:00, ECHO HEART

Case History:

Reason for Request: Dyspnea on exertion. Known Anomalous Pulmonary Venous Return. Assessment.

From clinical notes: Anomalous Pulmonary Venous Return. Previous cardiac interventions.

Findings: Echocardiogram demonstrates total anomalous pulmonary venous return to right atrium. All pulmonary veins drain to systemic venous circulation. Right heart volume overload. Pulmonary venous obstruction present. Recommend cardiology follow-up and continued surveillance.

Dr Sophie Richardson, Consultant Paediatric Cardiologist 27/03/2025, 00:00

Dr Michael Taylor, Consultant Paediatric Cardiologist 02/10/2025, 00:00

10/01/2025, 00:00, ECHO HEART

Case History:

Reason for Request: Suspected cardiac anomaly on antenatal scan. Known Tricuspid Atresia. Assessment.

From clinical notes: Tricuspid Atresia. Previous cardiac interventions.

Findings: Echocardiogram demonstrates tricuspid atresia with normally related great arteries. Hypoplastic right ventricle. Obligatory right-to-left shunt at atrial level. Pulmonary blood flow via VSD and PA. Recommend cardiology follow-up and MDT discussion.

Dr Sophie Richardson, Consultant Paediatric Cardiologist 10/01/2025, 00:00

23/05/2025, 00:00, ECHO HEART

Case History:

Reason for Request: Dyspnea on exertion. Known Coarctation of Aorta. Assessment.

From clinical notes: Coarctation of Aorta. Previous cardiac interventions.

Findings: Echocardiogram demonstrates coarctation of the aorta at the isthmus with peak gradient of 36 mmHg. Upper to lower limb blood pressure gradient of 38 mmHg. Left ventricular hypertrophy present. Bicuspid aortic valve also noted. Recommend cardiology follow-up and surgical planning.

Dr Michael Taylor, Consultant Paediatric Cardiologist 23/05/2025, 00:00

24/04/2025, 00:00, ECHO HEART

Case History:

Reason for Request: Family history of CHD. Known Atrioventricular Septal Defect. Assessment.

From clinical notes: Atrioventricular Septal Defect. Previous cardiac interventions.

Findings: Echocardiogram demonstrates complete atrioventricular septal defect. Common atrioventricular valve with moderate regurgitation. Primum atrial septal defect and inlet ventricular septal defect. Left atrial and left ventricular dilation. Recommend cardiology follow-up and surgical planning.

Dr Rachel Patel, Consultant Paediatric Cardiologist 24/04/2025, 00:00

16/04/2025, 00:00, CARDIAC MRI

Case History:

Reason for Request: Murmur detected on routine examination. Known Tetralogy of Fallot. Assessment.

From clinical notes: Tetralogy of Fallot. Previous cardiac interventions.

Findings: Echocardiogram demonstrates tetralogy of Fallot with right ventricular outflow tract obstruction. Pulmonary stenosis with peak gradient of 78 mmHg. Overriding aorta visualized. Ventricular septal defect present. Right ventricular hypertrophy noted. Recommend cardiology follow-up and MDT discussion.

Dr Oliver Matthews, Consultant Paediatric Cardiologist 16/04/2025, 00:00
